title: 107_s1656
content: The Act titled "Veterans Benefits Administration Improvement Act of 2001" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 contains findings related to the Act. The Veterans Benefits Administration is responsible for processing claims for veterans compensation and pension. Concerns have been raised about the accuracy of claims processing, with new measurements showing lower accuracy rates than previously reported. Additionally, the Administration may face a significant loss of workforce due to retirement by 2003. The Veterans Benefits Administration needs to ensure efficient processing of veterans claims as 30% of its workforce is expected to retire by 2003. In 2001, the appeals processing time for claims was 621 days, and there was a backlog of 533,029 claims as of September 2001. The Veterans Benefits Administration aims to improve the processing of veterans benefits claims due to an expected 30% workforce retirement by 2003. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a plan for improving claims processing within 90 days of this Act. The plan includes mechanisms for better training of adjudicators, enhancing employee accountability, and identifying recurring errors. The Veterans Benefits Administration aims to improve claims adjudications by enhancing data collection on common disabilities, addressing deficiencies in medical evidence, implementing a review system for accuracy, evaluating the impact of training programs, and setting quantifiable goals for these mechanisms. The Secretary must consult with veterans organizations and other parties to develop a plan for improving claims adjudications. The plan must be implemented 60 days after submission and can be modified with proper notification to relevant committees. Reports on progress must be submitted every six months. The Secretary must submit reports every six months to assess the implementation of the plan for improving claims adjudications, including whether goals are being achieved. Funding for the plan will come from appropriations for the Veterans Benefits Administration.
